intro: Erythraea aggregata, commonly known as the red sandalwood, is a deciduous tree native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its thick, aromatic bark and dark, heavy wood. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by orange-red fruits containing winged seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in dry forests and scrublands. Due to its valuable wood, it is also listed as an endangered species in some regions.
